intro: Lessertia depressa, commonly known as the dwarf lily or African lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its compact size and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
